title: Dependent Tuition Assistance Program (DTAP)
summary: Tuition and room/board assistance for dependents of deceased or permanently disabled Colorado National Guard members, law enforcement officers, firefighters, POWs, or MIA.

requirements.notes: Parent/sponsor must be deceased or permanently disabled while acting in official capacity, or POW/MIA.

eligibilityNotes: Dependents must enroll before age 24, maintain 2.5 GPA, complete FAFSA annually. Up to 8 semesters (6 years to complete). Covers tuition at public institutions PLUS room/board at base rates for standard double-occupancy. Non-public institutions: tuition comparable to public institution + room/board not to exceed public rates. Out-of-state: tuition only (no room/board). Does NOT cover summer/winter terms or institutional fees.

title: Colorado National Guard State Tuition Waiver
summary: Up to 100% tuition coverage at designated Colorado public institutions for active Colorado National Guard members (NEW program effective July 1, 2025).

requirements.notes: Replaces previous State Tuition Assistance ($5,000/semester) program. First-degree seekers prioritized.

eligibilityNotes: Must be active CONG member, accepted to Designated Institution of Higher Education, submit FAFSA/CASFA annually, maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress. Does NOT cover mandatory fees, textbooks, or expenses. Use Federal TA, GI Bill, or grants for remaining costs. 2-year service obligation per year of benefits received. No guarantee of award for subsequent semesters - each application evaluated independently. Apply during 20-day open enrollment periods (shortened from 30 days).

title: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption
summary: 50% exemption of the first $200,000 in actual property value for qualifying disabled veterans on their primary residence.

requirements.notes: Must be 100% permanently disabled (VA unemployability does NOT qualify). Applies to primary residence only.

eligibilityNotes: Veteran or spouse must have owned and occupied property as primary residence on January 1. If spouse is owner and veteran is not, veteran can still qualify if married on/before January 1 and both occupied as primary residence. Apply to Division of Veterans Affairs between January 1 - July 1 of qualifying year. Unremarried surviving spouses may continue exemption.

title: Free State Parks Access for Veterans
summary: Free admission to Colorado state parks for all active duty and veterans during August and on Veterans Day. Year-round free access for disabled veterans with special plates.

requirements.notes: August + Veterans Day: ALL active duty and veterans free. Year-round: Disabled veterans with state DV license plate.

eligibilityNotes: No residency requirement for August/Veterans Day access. Disabled veterans (50%+ rating) with Colorado DV license plate receive year-round free admission and campground discounts. 60%+ disability: free small-game hunting.

title: Free Lifetime Fishing License for Disabled Veterans
summary: Permanently disabled or individually unemployable veterans receive free lifetime fishing license.

requirements.notes: Must be permanently disabled or individually unemployable as determined by VA. Resident patient at military/VA medical facility also eligible.

eligibilityNotes: Apply through Colorado Parks and Wildlife with VA documentation. Lifetime license covers fishing privileges.

title: Colorado Wartime Veteran Bonus
summary: One-time $250 bonus per wartime deployment for qualifying Colorado veterans.

requirements.notes: One bonus per wartime deployment. Colorado residency required.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans may receive $250 bonus for each qualifying wartime deployment. Apply through Colorado Division of Veterans Affairs.

title: Vehicle Registration Fee Exemption for Disabled Veterans
summary: Colorado provides vehicle registration fee exemptions for qualifying disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Eligibility thresholds and covered fees may vary; applies to one vehicle.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must meet disability requirements and apply through their County Motor Vehicle Office.

title: Disabled Veteran License Plate
summary: Special license plates for eligible disabled veterans, which include parking and fee benefits.

requirements.notes: Disability threshold and benefits depend on plate type.

eligibilityNotes: Issued by the Colorado DMV with verification of VA disability status. Provides parking privileges and state parks access.

title: Colorado State Parks Disabled Veteran Pass
summary: Free or discounted access to Colorado State Parks for qualifying disabled veterans with 50%+ disability.

requirements.notes: Pass types and eligibility thresholds vary. 50%+: campground discounts. 60%+: additional hunting privileges.

eligibilityNotes: Apply through Colorado Parks and Wildlife with proof of disability. Disabled veterans with DV plates receive enhanced benefits.

title: Reduced-Fee Hunting & Fishing Licenses for Disabled Veterans
summary: Colorado offers reduced-fee hunting and fishing licenses to qualifying disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Eligibility depends on VA disability rating and residency. 60%+: reduced fees. 100%: free fishing.

eligibilityNotes: Licenses are issued through Colorado Parks and Wildlife. 60%+ disability: free small-game hunting. 100% P&T: free lifetime fishing.

title: Colorado Veterans Employment Preference
summary: Veterans and certain family members may receive preference in hiring for Colorado state government positions.

requirements.notes: Disabled veterans may receive additional preference points (10 points vs 5 points).

eligibilityNotes: Applies to qualifying veterans seeking state employment. Documentation such as DD-214 may be required. Surviving spouses may also qualify for preference under certain conditions.

title: Colorado State Veterans Community Living Centers
summary: Long-term care facilities providing nursing and assisted living services for eligible veterans.

requirements.notes: Admission depends on medical need, eligibility determination, and bed availability.

eligibilityNotes: Colorado operates Community Living Centers in: Aurora (Fitzsimons), Florence (Bruce McCandless), Homelake, Rifle, and Walsenburg (Spanish Peaks). Contact Colorado DMVA for admission criteria.

title: Colorado State Veterans Cemeteries
summary: State-operated cemeteries providing burial options for eligible veterans and family members.

requirements.notes: Eligibility generally mirrors VA national cemetery rules.

eligibilityNotes: Cemeteries: Veterans Memorial Cemetery of Western Colorado (Grand Junction) and Colorado State Veterans Center at Homelake Cemetery. Free burial for eligible veterans and dependents.
